benchmark_details.name: KMI (Korean Motivational Interviewing)
benchmark_details.overview: KMI is a synthetic dataset containing 1,000 high-quality Korean Motivational Interviewing dialogues generated through a framework that simulates MI sessions with the expertise of professional therapists.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to provide a resource for developing mental health chatbots grounded in Motivational Interviewing theory.

data.source: Generated using a framework simulating Motivational Interviewing sessions based on context data collected from a Korean psychological counseling platform.
data.annotation: Each therapist utterance is annotated with a therapist behavior label derived from MITI coding.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated through expert evaluations using a Likert scale to assess MI quality and general quality.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better adherence to MI principles and overall dialogue quality.
methodology.validation: Expert evaluation by professional counselors to assess dataset quality and utility.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data was collected from publicly available posts without interacting with users.
